name: PlayStation 4
summary: The PlayStation 4 system opens the door to an incredible journey through immersive new gaming worlds and a deeply connected gaming community. PS4 puts gamers first with an astounding launch line-up and over 180 games in development. Play amazing top-tier blockbusters and innovative indie hits on PS4. Developer inspired, gamer focused.

versions.name: Initial version
versions.summary: The PlayStation 4 system opens the door to an incredible journey through immersive new gaming worlds and a deeply connected gaming community. PS4 puts gamers first with an astounding launch line-up and over 180 games in development. Play amazing top-tier blockbusters and innovative indie hits on PS4. Developer inspired, gamer focused.

versions.name: PlayStation 4 Slim
versions.summary: "When comparing the new PS4 model to the current model, we’ve reduced volume by 30 percent, weight by 16 percent, and power consumption by 28 percent. Despite the sleek design, the new model packs all of the same powerful components that have made PS4 the best place to play."
versions.graphics: 1.84 TFLOPS, AMD Radeon based graphics engine
versions.connectivity: Super-Speed USB (USB 3.1 Gen1) port × 2, AUX port × 1, Ethernet?10BASE-T, 100BASE-TX, 1000BASE-T?×, IEEE 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac wi-fi, Bluetooth v4.0

versions.name: PlayStation 4 Pro
versions.summary:
Also Known as the PS4 Neo and PS4.5

"PS4 Pro is a high-end version of PS4 that is capable of outputting 4K graphics, HDR support, smoother and more stable framerates, and 4K video streaming. Upon its launch, PS4 Pro will make supported PS4 games look better and run more smoothly, while giving developers an upgraded toolset to create even richer, more detailed game worlds. How these powerful new tools are used is up to individual developers and the experience they are creating."
versions.graphics: 4.20 TFLOPS, AMD Radeon™ based graphics engine
versions.connectivity: Super-Speed USB (USB 3.1 Gen.1) port × 3, AUX port × 1, Ethernet (10BASE-T, 100BASE-TX, 1000BASE-T)×1, IEEE 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, Bluetooth® 4.0 (LE)
versions.resolutions: capable of running at up to 4K (3840 x 2160 pixels, also known as “2160p”) resolution
